@graph.headline: Shopify Collabs: A Guide to NOT Giving Away Your Store Keys
@graph.description: A comprehensive guide on using Shopify's collaborator access feature to securely grant external partners access to your store without sharing passwords.

@graph.name: How to Grant Collaborator Access in Shopify
@graph.description: Step-by-step process for securely granting external partners access to your Shopify store

step.name: Partner Sends Request
step.text: Log in to your Shopify Partners dashboard. Go to the 'Stores' section. Click the 'Add store' button, then select 'Request access to store.' Enter the store's URL and choose the permissions you need. You can also add a custom message. Click 'Send request' to notify the store owner.

step.name: Store Owner Approves Request
step.text: You will receive an email from Shopify with the collaborator request. Review the request carefully. Verify it's from the person you hired. Critically review the permissions they have asked for. You can uncheck any permission you are not comfortable granting. Once you are satisfied, approve the request.

mainEntity.name: Can I limit what a collaborator can see and do after I've approved them?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. As the store owner, you can edit a collaborator's permissions at any time by going to Settings > Users and permissions.

mainEntity.name: Why is this better than a staff account again?

acceptedAnswer.text: It's more secure, it creates a clearer audit trail for external partners, and it doesn't use up one of your paid staff slots, which can save you money.

mainEntity.name: Can a developer just request access without me knowing?

acceptedAnswer.text: They can send a request at any time, but they will never be granted access unless you, the store owner, explicitly approve it. You are always in control.

@graph.name: Shopify Collaborator Permissions
@graph.description: List of available permissions and their security implications

item.name: Themes Permission
item.description: High Risk - For designers and developers. Allows them to edit code and change the entire look and feel of your site.

item.name: Apps Permission
item.description: For partners installing or configuring apps. Be aware that some apps can access sensitive store data.

item.name: Products Permission
item.description: For store managers or marketers setting up a sale. They can add, edit, and delete products.

item.name: Orders Permission
item.description: Sensitive - For fulfillment teams or customer service reps. Contains customer names, addresses, and contact information.

item.name: Customers Permission
item.description: Highly Sensitive - Contains Personally Identifiable Information (PII). Should be granted with extreme caution.

item.name: Marketing Permission
item.description: For SEO specialists and ad agencies. Allows them to create campaigns, manage SEO, and run ad integrations.

item.name: Analytics Permission
item.description: Low Risk - Usually view-only access to reports on sales, traffic, and store performance.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Collaborator Access
hasDefinedTerm.description: A secure system that allows external partners to access specific parts of a Shopify store without sharing login credentials

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Partners Dashboard
hasDefinedTerm.description: The central hub where Shopify Partners manage their client stores and development work

hasDefinedTerm.name: Staff Accounts
hasDefinedTerm.description: Internal team accounts for employees who are part of day-to-day operations, count against plan limits

hasDefinedTerm.name: Collaborator Accounts
hasDefinedTerm.description: External partner accounts for freelancers, agencies, and consultants hired for specific tasks, do not count against staff limits

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Admin
hasDefinedTerm.description: The backend interface where store owners and authorized users manage their Shopify store

hasDefinedTerm.name: Least Privilege Principle
hasDefinedTerm.description: Security principle of granting only the minimum access necessary to perform required tasks

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Security
hasDefinedTerm.description: Security practices and features for protecting Shopify stores from unauthorized access and data breaches

hasDefinedTerm.name: Shopify Permissions
hasDefinedTerm.description: Granular access controls that determine what areas of a Shopify store a user can view and modify
